field.name: summary
field.value: Macros doesn't work if invoked from a template that uses a layout

field.name: description
field.value:
Quoting the post
"I'm having trouble using global velocimacros in .vm files that are contained within a layout .vm file. For instance, if I have a layout called "standard.vm", my global macro #something() works fine. However, inside "list.vm" which uses Layout("standard"), if I use #something() it doesn't resolve."
http://forum.castleproject.org/viewtopic.php?p=543#543

comment.author: jsimons
comment.text: Jono, any idea how to fix this?

comment.author: jonorossi
comment.text:
According to the forum thread this isn't a bug, and is by design. The layout is processed after the view so the child content can be inserted.
Using the macros directory, a viewcomponent or a helper are the suggested workarounds.
